comments: He likes to joke and make the class fun. However, you must really pay attention to what he said if you wanted to get good grade. He is willing to help if you need extra time.
great teacher very helpful if you ask a question i notice the people that are doing bad in class don\'t talk or ask for help.
Majority of tests are take home, group work is encouraged even on tests.
Lots of Extra Credit, promotes group work, always available for help and questions related or not to the class

This guy was the worst teacher I ever had.In class all you do is copy off the board, as he spends all class writing on it without saying or explaining anything.He has favorites who already know calculus in his class and just jokes around with them instead of teaching, and if you ask him to explain anything he gets angry and dismisses you.

Tony Wiggins should not be teaching calculus. The first day began with "for those of you who have not scene calculus before" ... In the first calculus. He will be hard, you will have to dedicate a lot of time to learn the material as his class will not do it. I do not recommend him at all.

I think Tony is a really cool guy, but not a very good math teacher. The class was really confusing for those of whose who aren\'t good at math and he expected everybody to know what he was talking about. He was always available to help you with anything after class which was awesome and extremely beneficial.

What kind of a student would write a review saying it\'s okay for a teacher to choose favorites? Then go on to say he is not so bad for doing so? Only a teacher himself would write such a thing. What a shame.

I dont think he\'s bad at all. Actually, I think is pretty good and very funny. In my class, he answered everyone\'s questions even if it\'s stupid. But, he does choose favorites, and he helps them outside of class. Overall, a decent and funny teacher.

Not a good teacher. Expected the students to already know what he was doing without explaining it. Sometimes funny, but that\'s not what\'s important. He gets off topic easily and rarely helps a student when they ask for it one on one in class. He just tells you to look at your book to learn it.

Tony is one of the best teachers I\'ve ever had. His class was very challenging, but I learned more because of that. He\'s extremely knowledgable, very funny, and all-around great. I\'m signed up to take another class with him already!

Tony rocks! He goes out of his way to find ways to make the concepts make sense. Calc has a HIGH failure rate and he works w/students to learn the material so they succeed. Take his class, you will not regret it. He wants to see students succeed. It\'s night & day from my prev Calc I prof at BCC. I learned soo much bc of his teaching style!

Attendance is important, students that stuggle do not practice the homework or participate in class. This teacher is willing to help, the students just need to ask for it. Very funny class comments, very knowledgeable in math plus a few other things. Show up and do the homework and ask questions and you will get and easy A

Tony was my favorite math teacher I\'ve ever had. He works with students outside of class, and will go through problems step-by-step if need be. His instruction is clear, interesting, and encourages participation from the class. Overall a fantastic teacher.
I highly recommend this teacher, he uses a lot of worksheets and goes out of his way to create student success. I really enjoy his teaching style.

he is really nice guy, but not as teacher. he don\'t want to solve any problem when we ask for solving a problem he said the answer and when we ask how we can do that he says you should fallow that rulea. Instead of explain math problem he just writing a English. I think he can be a good English teacher not Math.
